title.narrative: CTO- Centro de Teatro do Oprimido

description.narrative:
The Maputo CTO is a non-profit Cultural Association, legally constituted by public deed of July 16, 2003 and published in Boletim da República nº4 III Series on January 24, 2007. It is a member and is advised by the Theater Center of the Oppressed (CTO) of Rio deJaneiro - Brazil. For the Center of Theater of the Oppressed, improving the living conditions of the population, within the construction of an ideal future, means forming a society conscious and committed to the values of social justice, citizenship and awakeningthe critical spirit for decision making. With solid experience in the assembly of shows with social themes, presenting them in a playful and didactic way through various techniques, the CTO possessed the capacity to contribute through integrated actions with community leaders, community and advocacy with the government, besides offering advice for institutions and organizations that want viable and economic alternatives, with direct involvement of the beneficiaries, to operationalize communication strategies, applying theater techniques as a pedagogical and mobilizing tool. It is a commitment of the Theater of the Oppressed (TO) to invest in the improvement of community capacities to carry out an in-depth analysis of the adopted development policies, questioning and motivating theparticipation of all, having as basic presupposition the need to build the spirit of citizenship the obligation and demand the rights). The Strategic Plan for 2013-2018 is the first exercise of the Center of Theater of the Oppressed (CTO), its process outlines strategic guidelines that will support and inspire the activities in the next six years and comes in compliance with the objectives ofconsolidation and growth of the CTO . The construction process isthe result of discussions and discussions among CTO members, activists, and wildcats in which meetings were held to reach consensus on the guidelines for intervention.
Vision The Theater of the Oppressed as an effective tool for expression, transformation and social mobilization for a more democratic society and social justice in Mozambique.
Mission Strengthening of communities in Theater of the Oppressed techniques for the exercise of citizenship in identifying and seeking answers to problems that affect their lives.
